++ Food Recipe Chana Masala With Potatos


NOTES:

    * Soak chic peas overnight!

    * I used 1.5 cups wet soaked chana, not dry
    
    * 4x this recipe is slightly too much for crockpot slightly, gets to 3/4, 
      should stay near 2-3 but it can work.

INGREDIENTS

    1 1/2 cups dry Chickpeas (chana)
    
    3 tablespoons Oil
    1 teaspoon Cumin Seeds
    2 Bayleaves
    2 Cardamom Pods
    
    3/4 cup medium sized Onion, finely chopped
    
    
    1 1/2 cups Tomatoes, finely chopped
    1 tablespoon finely minced Garlic
    1 tablespoon finely minced Ginger
    2 Green Chillies, finely chopped (Serrano Peppers will work)
    
    
    1 1/4 teaspoon Salt
    1 teaspoon Turmeric Powder
    1 teaspoon Red Chilli Powder (or Paprika Powder)
    
    2 potatoes, cut into quarters - (or omit, or use cauliflower)
    
    3/4 teaspoon Garam Masala
    1 tablespoon Kasuri Methi (optional)
    Chopped coriander for topping

    
DIRECTIONS

    1. Sautee in oil in pressure cooker (no lid duh):
        cumin seeds, 
        bayleaf
        coriander pods. 
        Once the seeds start spluttering, add the onions and cook 
        until they are soft (about 3-4 minutes)
        
    2.  Add 
        tomatoes, 1.5 cups x 4 = 6 cups
        garlic, 
        ginger, 
        green chillies, 
        salt, 
        turmeric powder 
        and chilli powder 
        
        to the pot. Cook till the tomatoes break down and start 
        becoming mushy
        
    3. Add the chickpeas, potatoes and 2 1/2 cups water to the pot. 
       Pressure cook for ??30 minutes
       
       
    4. open the cooker and add garam masala and kasuri methi (if using).
